When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and á her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. On my way back I met my mother who had á been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw á how much she had worried (herself).

A parking fine.
We were at secondary school and I was making a lot of noise.  The á teacher came to ask us as to who was making all the noise.  I did á not own up so the  whole class was punished.

When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

When I lied at home.   I told them that I was going to a á Christian meeting and I went to see my boyfriend instead.

A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and when I tried to help á her I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like a á fool.

A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street á with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the á other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to á interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I á kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I á promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after á a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

My cousin knocked on the door, looking for me to get her watch á back.  I had given it to my girlfriend, Lizzy, as a present.
One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I á did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had á a bad conscience and felt guilty.
When I was afraid to tell my sports teacher at secondary school á that I had not participated in the sports activities the previous á day.
I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then, á neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell á him about the accident and I will never tell him.
It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl á but I considered it only as an \affair\". Only much later I realized á
After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key á inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own á house but the house of people I hardly knew.
My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I á prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had á failed.  I wished that I had helped him.
I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.
When I took drugs.
I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no á possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 á p.m.
I remember deceiving my brother, I told him that I was going to á attend the Sunday service, instead I went out to the town with a friend.
After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I á felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive á behavior.
When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it á when asked about it later.
When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for á myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.
When I insulted an elderly person for no reason.
During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I á accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.
When I gave in to what my wife wanted and locked the cat out, it á was killed by the dogs.
I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I á had wanted to.
When my uncle found me having sexual intercourse with a distant á relative of mine in the sitting room, on the couch.  I failed to á stop and get up, I carried on.
When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. á Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried á and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.
When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.
When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  á which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have á thought that I had been stealing.
I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment á but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed á holiday job.
When I beat up my son for having beaten up his sister.

During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me á outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain á hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the á circumstances
When I was caught sneaking back into the house at night after á having  gone to a disco without permission.
I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which á I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt á guilty.
My brother wanted money but I refused to give it to him, two days á later he stole it from my father.
When I was caught with my girlfriend in the house at night.
When my mother returned from a holiday, I told her a lie i.e my á father had brought another woman home while she was away.
I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. á My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped á my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.
Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the á theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical á driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest á cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too á old for me.
When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards á it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved á time for it.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother á always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting á my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I á just behaved aggressively towards my sister.
I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning, á although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From á 3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused á because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my á boyfriend found out.
[ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all á the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]
While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, á though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to á demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.
My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get á her on my back, she slipped and fell.
One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was á supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been á spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.  á I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this á neighbour's house.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that á I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. á However, the next day I said the same thing.
I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting á I forgot to take the minutes.
One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back á she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I á decided not to talk to her.
I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was á crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not á stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...
When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial á problems.

I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, á for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf á and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me á that she had been waiting for some news from us.

I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, á particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had á left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on á the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.
I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had á to plead guilty.
When I was involved in a car crash.
When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in á my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  á morning for manual work.
When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
When quarreling with friends.
I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in á love with another man.
When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.  á He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When á we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his á way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he á finally arrived but after a very long time).
I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several á weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that á two of them perished.

My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought á back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend á thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told á me that the change was not correct.
When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I á felt guilty the next day.

I send a word to my boss through my servant telling him that I á would not report for work as I was not feeling well and that the   á doctor had refused to give me sick leave.  My intention was á actually to go out of Lusaka for a week-end.  I left the same day á and the following morning my boss found me in Mongu.  I felt á guilty when asked to explain things on my return.
I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did á not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid á that he would grumble.
I accused my husband of being late deliberately when he came to á pick me up from work.
A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á reason for her action.
I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and á growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until á several weeks later.
When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she á would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.

A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept á putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for á days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I á felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do á what she had requested me to do.
I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day á in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold á for half an hour.
I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for á it, and I was caught red handed.

Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and á felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed á person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having á given her this additonal problem.
After the death of a girl who I disliked.
When I had broken a piece of glass of the refrigerator by putting á a hot pan in it.
I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close á friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being á right dominated.
I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was á impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense á of guilt.
Adolescent guilt growing up feeling \bad, immoral\" sexual á
A sense of guilt I felt once when I couldn't defend the á confidence my teacher had in me and thus discrediting him at a á concert.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I á could have avoided.
I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the á plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made á me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.
When I misled a person: I said that I would do her a á favour and didn't.
When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness á to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.
A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his á life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power á to support his frustration and his behavioral change.
It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whom á I have frequent relationships but nothing special.
This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my á mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.
I was late meeting someone for an appointment.
When I provoked a fight with my mother, hurting her feelings very á much.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.

I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she á wouldn't want me to and I would get into trouble if she found á out. But she was only partly justified in forbidding me to use á it. She never found out.
When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension á between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had á of me !

I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I á categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any á hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because á I couldn't organize myself.

I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship á between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I á moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard á and didn't previously know about I suspect.
I offended my mother.
While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and á someone elses in a minor way.
Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who á the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and á bad but it was too late.
I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned á my sister out of my parents home.
I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.
I couldn't fulfill a promise.
I stroke a person undeservedly.
Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly á the use of another person.
When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close á personal relationship.
I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having á an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because á my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close á warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything á I could and that his progress of a \normal\" life was poor I felt á
It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a á present together. However, now I had bought something together á with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
The same event described under \shame\"."
Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had á given her no attention.
The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end á of the semester at the University.
I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch á if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming á was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.
The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's á eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.
When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorry á and try to bypass the situation.

When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing wather á to each other in front of the door of my house. One day we á decided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped and á went to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.
When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of the á fight, I feel guilty.
I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go, á I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.
When I slapped a nephew who did something that I considered á wrong, and I was reprehended for this.
Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to á structure.
Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do á it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast. á I felt guilty - \he's just done all that work for me\"."
When I stared to much at a pastry that a woman was eating and at á the same instant the pastry felt on the floor.
When I was starting in romance with my husband, we went out to á curt, and we stayed in the car \making love\". At the time I was á

In adolescence I had a very violent fight with my sister I hold á her stong in her neck, she had a throat surgery what make me feel á guilty about the future reactions she might had injuring the á surgery.
Two timing - going out with 2 guys at once (secretly).
I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment á when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.
When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she á didn't really do.
When I knew that my niece did a bad schoolar examination because á I couldn't explain her the lesson.
Yesterday I broke my sister's raio. She hears it always when she á has school examinations and now she has examinations.
When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why, á I accepted to do the test for army.

The greatest guilt I felt and I didn't know if it was really á justified is that when I was a child I had a brother very close á to me. He  became ill, and asked me to see  him in the hospital. á I didn't go, when his situation became worse in the U.I.T. (Unity á of intensive therapy) I went and he died.
When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else á whom I loved and who was not in any way responsible for what had á happened (my sister).

My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I á felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the á feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling á of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.
When I fought with my sister and said that she had provoked this. á She was very seriously scolded.
I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up with á life. I really dont know the reason.
One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.
I borrowed a friend's books and forgot I had them, she asked for á them back and I told her I didn't have them. I duly found and á returned them.

One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well, á but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought á about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone á farther.
Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.
When I forgot to take out money for my mother. She asked me what á she would do, because I had messed up her program for the á following day.
I felt guilt when I betrayed the person whom I loved.
When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it á pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.
Facing the possibility of having a child when it wasn't either á desired or permitted.
I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certain á person to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knew á what I wanted.
When I robbed a loop in supermarket.

When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I á felt at the time I had to relay the information back to the á person concerned, as I felt the situation volitile, did this á without telling my lover, she felt like piggy in the middle, as á she was not directly concerned. Maybe you could call it gossip I á felt different after I had slept on it. If I had waited, thought, á NOW I would not have done it.
When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my á mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward á factors.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
When I masturbated in my room.
I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had á enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My á friend relied on them.
I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. á My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.
I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have á to tell them I have failed an exam.
Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was á directly involved in it.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident á but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my á brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it á impossible that had driven the car.
I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped á me for everything.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take á him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.
When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high á tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.
Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital á after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
I didn't attend lectures.
I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set á quite involuntarily.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a á restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without á finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up á the idea.

Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without á knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I á came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents á when I remembered how much they had done for me.
I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having á called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the á whole night.
I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I á said I had not passed my last exam.

When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our á mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my á classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first á mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more á than that and I put down \very good\" for fear of being scolded. á

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague á of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good á notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know á why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was á on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.
The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my á studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They á believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still á haven't had time to see her.
A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my á studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary á examination.
I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days á later he died.
I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my á lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the á girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my á mother's presence.
I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á felt guilty before her.
I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I á lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of á trouble.
I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.
When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home á because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a á man. But it remained undone.
My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame á bacause with her it is a stress disease.
When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had á discussed and I had to be one better.

My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I á started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without á knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it á back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that á it was my fault.
My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of á mine.
In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they á greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I á have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.
When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught, á then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come á and get me.
I had to leave an important function early because of family á commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.
I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while á in a position of trust.
When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a á group.
For example, when I have promised something but I haven't á fulfilled it.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with á baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk á convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the á police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to á find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. á But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am á to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is á not late still.
When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.
When I offended my parents without wanting it.
I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I á haven't done it.
Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my á mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel á when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt á I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and á guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to á Catholicism but then once received - o.k.
Low evaluation of other people's cares.
Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental á rest. Staff on your return query your \sickness\" - it is easier á
When I don't fulfill my obligations.
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity á better but I had not done it because of reluctance or á carelessness.
My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of á amidophen.
When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important á family occasion that I should not have missed.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He á had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison á with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of á guilt.

This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I á (being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in á and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months á later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel á guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for á myself and my future.
When I offend somebody unfairly.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.

Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was á really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, á because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to á feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.
When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of á yours and you are at the bottom of it.

I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole á week (I am a student trainee teacher). Anyway the other teachers á thought this was okay because the teacher I was supposed to á observe was not well liked. The teacher was in fact really nice á to me - but I wanted to get out of teaching a hard topic he had á given me.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.
Lack of respect for my parents.

I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty á at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being á a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this á emotion)
I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a á lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the á place.

Attending to a demand made by a client (I work in a bank) I á suggested her an application of money in a week ahead, but I á informed her wrongly. The client arrived a week after and the á application wasn't made and she lost with this a lot of time and á money.
When my father had a serious fight with my sister, because of me.
I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the á presence of my friends.
When I see that my mother forces my little brother (15 years) to á work very hard for school. I don't agree that she constantly puts á him to work, but I don't tell it to her, so nothing changes.
I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in á getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I á felt I had lied to them.

I told someone that I still had a relationship with a boy á although it was finished already 3 months before. That person á seriously discussed several things relating that issue. Then I á felt very miserable because I had told lies.
In Biarritz (the South of France) I met some English students á who, especially for me, went to Paris and gave me food, while I á didn't have any more money.
When my father told me that I should help my mother more often, á because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.
I was walking quite quickly and unthinking through a children's á playground, when a toddler ran in front of me I knocked him over á and he hit his head quite hard and began crying.

I borrowed a piece of music of someone and I always forgot to á give it back. That person wrote me a letter asking me to give it á back. I did so and I told him an idle story why I kept it for so á long.
I broke my friend's badminton racket and she kept quiet about it.
I was in grade seven and my class was planning a protest against á a rude and immoral teacher.  I sneaked out and told the á headmaster about it and so the plan was foiled.
I beat up a female friend after I heard the defamatory stories that á she had been telling.  I was later called to explain my á behaviour.
When I was made to feel responsible for the emotional state a friend of á mine was in.
I have cut loose from my father a few years ago. I know he is á very sad about this.
When my friend needed my help very much and I, at that moment, made á an end to our relationship.
When I was caught with another man's wife.  I had taken the á opportuinty as this man was abroad but he returned that night.
Someone had to do a lot of efforts to make something work. With á my help he would have finished much sooner, but I wasn't in the á mood to help him.
After a courtship of three months I made an end to it. The boy á was very sad about this.
When I tell someone no. In other words when I refuse to do á something although I could have helped him.
I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was á fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.
I ate 12 biscuits one night after tea while watching TV - I don't á know why.

I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a á friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my á boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. á After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell á him that.
When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a á chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working á outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it á myself.

Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her á duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she á absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently á were hit by our father).
When I was rude to my mother and got angry with her.
I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying á for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.
I wanted to finish a relationship after 3 months. Unfortunately á my friend had a different opinion. I could not answer his á feelings this made him unhappy, and me feel guilty.
When I realised that I had rejected a boy, who was fallen in love á with me, rather bluntly four times.
After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were \inflated\" á
Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.
My girlfriend and I agreed to go to the cinema. However I á completely forgot our appointment. I remembered it two hours á too late when I went to visit her.
Ignoring my parents'wishes.
I felt guilty when I skipped a two hour practical class I knew I á would miss out on more information which I did not know, but I á couldn't cope with going.
When I used to tell Mum I was going somewhere else than where I á was (going).
After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and á felt guilty about having taken it.
A friend of mine had a bicycle-accident because I pulled at his á handlebar.
When I was young, I stole some money from my mother's purse. It á wasn't very much, but I can remember when she found it gone I á felt very guilty.
When I took the car of someone without saying it to him.
I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in á Nijmegen where I study.

I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to á come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I á myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other á situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á them.
I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my á birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.
When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back á home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.
When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.
I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from á living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We á are very close sisters.
Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. á Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their á group, although it was late in the evening.
When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came á to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously á met.
On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By á chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for á the dress-rehearsal of \Aida\". It was a different world for us á
The day I was told that I had passed my Malawi School leaving á Exams and I was selected to go to college.
When I was informed that a short story I had written had been á accepted for publication.
I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I á was completely healthy.

In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small á picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and á cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had á for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.
After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
I was given a gift by my sister. There were many pleasant things á in this parcel.
When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I á had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a á malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.
When I was admitted to the University.
When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever á cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to á learn that it was me who was delaying things.
Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.
I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for á me, I was very glad.
Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her á abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our á suprise she had a baby 2 months back.
When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a á margin of three marks.
I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was á not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve á the pains of a patient.
When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial á difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that á present, he was not obliged to do so.
When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in á the family after 19 years of baby boys.
When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.
In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I á was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I á wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I á wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started á to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and á felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold, á and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.
When I got my first unknown compound while doing my M.Sc á research, I was very happy.  This is because my research was based á on this type of reactions and compounds.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.
This happened a year when I was having a hard time, I got á admission to do research despite obstacles in the procedure of admission.
When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one á stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.
When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I á like.
Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed á terribly.
When I got the loan for my studies.
New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the á steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the á first time.
When I worked as an \au-pair-girl\" in London, I received a call á
When I had passed MCE examinations.
I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very á much.
After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more á glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.
I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault, á everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he á surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.
A meeting and a conversation with a woman (somewhat elder than á me) who considers me as her child (she also has one child of her á own). Last two years I lived with her (no relationship).
When I got the first compound through column.
The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in á it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed á to us that this was almost impossible to happen.
It was about a fortnight ago, I was declared successful in the á U.G.C exam this year (only four in Bombay succeeded).  My joy á knew no bounds.

After waiting impatiently for the results of the form 5 á examinations for almost a year, at last I received a letter of á acceptance from the Senate of the university of Zambia telling á me that I had made it to the first year course at UNZA.
I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a á great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the á large number of pupils who fail.
When I got admission in M.Sc (I) Organic Chemistry, I was very á happy.
Meeting a loved man.
When I received the first year results as the first year had á involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the á results.
Getting a good mark for a subject I had worked hard at but á expected only a moderate mark.
When I was accepted at UNZA.
When we got a young dog.
When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I á thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of á joy.
After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend, á who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.
When my father bought me a suit.
While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  á and amusing sketch.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
I was joyful when I received a present (2 books and a pencil) á from the headmaster in standard 6 because I had passed, I became á No 1 and he said I was one of the pupils who had good behaviour.
When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after á having been sick for a week.

I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very á happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I) á examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have á ever scored in my life.
When my brother was selected to the University of Malawi (the á Polythecnic). I was very excited and I rejoiced due to one of our á family members qualifying for University level at long last.
In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got á me a three day furlough.
After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á feels glad.
When I won the best prize in the National science fair.
After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had á passed all my written examinations.
Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.
On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought á me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.
When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings á in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with á complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the á hand of the other person, etc...
I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train á arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt á glad.
After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in á 1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the á Examination when the results were out.
I was emotionally happy when I was in love with the girl I had á longed for.
I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. á ( I had not seen her for several months.)
When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to á win the Cup of England.
I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running á competition.
Seeing relations from overseas after a few years.
My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         á primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  á Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was á spontaneous and lots of fun.
On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet á of flowers.
When I was offered a place in the university as a full time á student.
When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.
When my special friend said \I love you\" for the first time."
When I was selected to the university of Zambia.
When I passed a very important exam.
When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.
When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the á teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.
I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á being alive.
When I received my promotion letter.
The more than satisfactory result of a recently-completed á university subject was communicated to me by phone.
When I won a tennis match.
Getting a phone call from a very old friend.
A night spent with a group of friends.
Emotional reassurances by spouse.
I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former á secondary school.
A recurrent lovesickness.
When I heard that someone who is very close to me did very well á in the exams despite having fooled around a lot.
When my term paper was evaluated.
After a long time (of no communication with him, physical á illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected á to see him.
At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging á that fact to members of family and friends.
It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on á the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept á quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.
Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with á whom I get along very well.
Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.

To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the á circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps á because it has been one of the good things that I learned with á this friend.
When I was selected to start Form I at Malosa Secondary school.
When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six á years, came back home safe and in good health.
When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.

In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass á two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned á myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these á examinations.
When I fell in love with \X\".  Overnight I felt confidence, self-esteem,    á
When I heard that I had passed my end of first year exams and I á was ready to enter 2nd year because I felt I had failed as they were á very hard.
Always when I meet the person I love.
I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á examination.
The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for á a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be á selected.
When the person that I was very fond of, returned to me.

Made a wonderfull new friend.
When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank á and danced.
When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my á registration at UNZA.
When my girl and I decided to get back together after our á separation.
When I first came to the campus.
When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long á time, would come and see me.
I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all á lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only á English classes)
My boyfriend returned after a long absence.
When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had á not expected to do so well.
When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á one).
I was very happy when I received the year end results as I was á worried about how well I had done.  I was very happy to know that I á had passed.
I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 á exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my á birthday.
When I heard that I had passed my MCE Exam, I spent the whole á day dancing and eating sugarcanes from our garden.
When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would á be definately selected to the university of Zambia.
I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I á was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
My 21st birthday celebration, when I cut the cake and received á the presents.
My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at á the station.
When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the á university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola á secondary school.
When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university á telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
When my first niece was born.
On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a á bird.(swans of the bay)
When I passed my Primary school leaving certificate and selected á to go to a Boarding secondary school.
I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working á place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á the Higher Agricultural Institute.
When I was in the sauna bath.
I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long á time.
Receiving a much wanted letter from a very good friend who lives á abroad.
A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present.

I won the first prize at the science fair, the first of the kind á at school and I was only in form II then.
I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced á at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies á depended on it.
When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.
When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a á profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.

It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my á astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

Good dinner on the National Day.
When I saw that I had passed the university entrance exam.  It á made me forget all my problems.

Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous á when my school's team won the conference championship last year.
When my son was born.
I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful á scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus á the picnic was worthwhile.
When I went for a picnic in Lonavala, I felt full of joy.
Being asked to go out by someone I care.
When my brother was born.
After attending a song contest proposed by a band called \Chyne\" á

When I received the result slip of the higher level examination á (an university entrance exam) and saw that I had a very good á possibility of being accepted into the university, I felt very á excited.

I had a dream : I had a very close friend who had several stone á houses in the New Territories (villages) but they did not have á much furniture.  He took me to see his fields (I had never seen á them before) and there were several inches of clear water on á which the sunshine was reflected.  I wanted to sit among the á short green plants in the fields but was afraid of treading the á plants to death.  My friend said \They will not die\" and I sat á
The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on á holiday.
I acted in an English play in college and got the Best Actress á award, while our play got the first place.
Getting a letter from a friend who did not write for a long time.

During the exam period I studied in the library alone.  A close   á friend of mine, who is also a classmate, told me that my á application for a Japanese inter-cultural exchange programme had á been accepted.  I was not very sure as I did not know that the á list had been declared.  I ran to the board and saw that I was á really included in the list.  I was so excited that I smiled all á day long.  When I met my classmates and friends I told them the á good news.  I was so happy that I could not concentrate on my á studies. á
When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on á unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with joy that á evening.

That afternoon I rushed home to look at the result slip of the á higher level as fast as possible.  I opened the envelope very á carefully and found that my results were much better than I á had expected and thus I could enter the Chinese university.  My á diligence had paid and I was very happy.

I experienced joy at a friend's 22nd birthday party. We had good á food, good liquid, good company, good music, and an overall warm á atmosphere. The birthday girl and I communicate incredibly well. á I felt very content, warm and inspired just talking with her á giving her a neck massage.
When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University - á it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.

My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very á close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought á one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that á we have a great new design - it's always the same.
Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 á years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the á \paper work\" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming á
I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months. á  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we á went there because we knew we would meet there.
When I attended the concert of a pop singer.
My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise á birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along á too.
After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very á happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.
When my family allowed me to do higher studies.
When I had a good result in the certificate examination.
My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good á time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took á interest.
After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was á very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.
When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
When the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the final á of the Europe Cup at Athens.

During my Summer vacations I planned a carnival for the community á youth center with a few other volunteers.  I was the head of the á organizors and we spent over a month planning it.  During this á period we got to know and understood each other.  We á discovered each others potential and we planned many interesting á things for the carnival.  The day of the carnival everything was á bright, the programmes went well and the attendants enjoyed it.  á I felt extremely excited about it.
My admittance to the University.
I preached to a F.3 students in a gospel camp.  They thus knew á more about God and made up their minds to believe in Jesus.
I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen á for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some á ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.
When high level results were declared, I found my candidature á number.  I was very happy as I had not expected it.  As I had been  á injured before the examination and I had performed poorly.

I thought that I was going to fail a subject and so I began to á study for the final exam, then my friend told me that I had á passed it.  That meant that I could go home, as I do not study in á my hometown.
I spoke with a friend on the phone who I haven't seen in many á years. It was a joyful event to talk to him.
I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship á grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found á out how he felt about me.
When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for á her all night, not knowing where she was.
Winning Queensland Chess Championship.
Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and á wine.
Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which á revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had á thought possible.
Being in love for the first time.
I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was á Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did á well on a test.
When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was á happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to á have a good time without alcohol.

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted á to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how á things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it á was really good - though really insane conversation.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
In August,1983, the long awaited \big envelope\" (a document for á
When I gave birth to a healthy boy.
Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).
When my father was saved from a severe work accident.
When my husband and I decided to take a few days holiday after a á particularly trying period.
Last year I passed the B.A exams in Psychology in which I stood first á in my class.  Thus I got the first prize from the college.  I was á most happy to tell all this to my parents and friends.
Doing well in an examn.

The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and á they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed á me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left á for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.
Riding home from school after completing two midterms in two á days, and feeling I did well on them.
When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it á was put against my breast.
When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus á Christ as his saviour and Lord.
Success in university entrance examination.
During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy á I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I á like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........
I received a letter from a distant friend.
Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. á Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.
Receiving notification that I had made a successful application á to the Speech Therapy course at Uni, gave me a very good feelig á of achievment and joy.
When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.

My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up á on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two á mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good, á it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.
When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of á Psychology.
Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of á separation from summer.
When they told me that I had got a study grant.
I went home and visited with my family and friends.
When I got a first class in the twelveth standard exams, I was very á surprised and happy and I had a very good time with my friends.
It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend. á   She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of á the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.á
When my 6 month old son is happy and well.
When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was á very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.
Talking with a nice girl.
When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling á me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a á clinical pilot study.
When I passsed the M.S.C board exams with first class, which I á had not expected.

On my birthday, my closest friends were here at Berkeley pithched á in a lot of money each and bought me ten records to replace some á of my records that were stolen. They threw a small surprise party á for me too.
One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in á the presence of my friends by giving me a present.
I was very happy when I passed the B.A with first class marks.
When I got to know that I had passed the university entrance á exam.  I thought that I had done one of the exams badly.
A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea á seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish á to the others.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.
When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful á little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I á followed her out, then witnessed them being born.
When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.

When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  á cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  á said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  á impression of me.
Good news about a sick relative.
On holidays - just driving along a road beautiful scenery. Just á with my boyfriend - not really talking but just feeling á overwhelmed.
When I received a letter from the university telling me that my á application had been accepted.

I had a picnic with old classmates, we chatted and played games.
Watching China winning the Asian Olympic games.

Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately á happy until a year or so ago.
When after 10 months of national service I was \downgraded\" and á

I realized that a fellow member had grown spiritually.  I was the á leader of a spiritual group and had prayed for him.  He did not á want to burn the incense but his mother forced him to do it.  á Finally his mother told him that he could discontinue if he got á good results at school.

My parents and my relatives á praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B, á 2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.
I was accepted by the Chinese university.

When my little sister was born.

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting á for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly, á inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful á that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think \what á

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really á happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me á made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another á person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she á asked me.
The begining of my relations with my current girlfriend.
When I asked my girlfriend to marry me.
I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she á had obtained a grant to work in the library.

Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in á a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings, notions and á every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I á was very happy and satified.
My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all á very worried but it was successful.
The day the results of the university entrance exam was á published, I found my canditate number and I was very excited.
I am happpy when I get good results in the field of academics or á athletics.

When I met a friend that I hadn't seen for some time.

When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.

I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.

Yesterday my friend gave me a gift and had dinner with me.
The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor á said that the ear was completely all right.

I realized the girl liked to be with me.
After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my á first love called me and told me that he would always care for me á no matter what I did.

When my application for studying the masters degree was accepted.
When i was asked to be a child's godmother.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special á occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my á family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process á which have been going on for centuries.
When I took my entrance exams successfully and also when I got my á school leaving certificate because the delivering ceremony was á extremely official.
After watching the 49ers lose game after game, year after year, I á was finally rewarded with a Super Bowl victory which made me á extremely happy.
When I finished the work that I had planned to do - my homework.
Several good friends made me a surprise visit and this made me á happy.  They are my closest friends and we had not seen each á other for a long time.
When I passed an important exam.
When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later á accepted.

I remember my religious experience.  During  a gospel camp, a few á friends of mine decided to believe in God.  The joy that I felt á at that time was more than words can express.  I blessed them and á praised God in my heart.

I learnt from the newspaper that I had been accepted at the á Chinese university of H.K.  It was 7 o'clock in the morning.  á Later I told my family and relatives about it and had tea with á them very joyfully.
I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour á of a competition.
After a busy day I went back to my hostel.  I closed the door and á had a drink, then I read my favourite book on the bed.  Suddenly á I felt peace and joy.
The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the á final at Athens.
I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my á friends.

When I read the newspaper that morning I found my candidature á number on the admission list of the Chinese university.  I was á satisfied and happy and the cumulative anxiety disappeared.  I á only wanted to cry out that I had succeeded.
Third highest grade in the class and the best answer given for á one question (the question was graded by the professor and he á indicated he liked my answer).
When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to á be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed á for it.

When I finished my C.S. Project I was overjoyed. I felt relieved á because it was due the next day and I was tired of looking at it.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had á been admitted to the university.

One Saturday afternoon, I deliberately dressed up nicely (I had á been in a bad mood of late).  I hoped to go for a walk in the á soft sunlight to try and uplift my spirits.  When I was having á lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to á why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me á before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would á look very nice if we wore them together.
When we were able to afford a new sofa - a leather one which cost á SEK 20000.  I had waited for it for 2-3 years.

After completing high-school, I wanted to go abroad for a á holiday.  I had never been abroad before and neither had I taken á a holiday for a long time.  When finally my parents agreed and we á got the airplane tickets I was over joyed.

Day before yesterday my mother bought me a new pair of shoes, á without my having asked for them.  She told me that when she saw á the pair of shoes she felt like buying them for me.  I really á liked the shoes and they made me feel that my mother cares for á me.
My boyfriend made me a proposal.
Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.
I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at á first he had said that he would not do that.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.
When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.
Found out that me and my best friend are both chosen for the á English lectures.
When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something á you have striven to.
Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a á long time.

The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call á from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of á the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was á an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I á had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

Last year my freshman yr. It was a day in March I did well on á some tests. I seemed to finally adjust to college, it was hot and á sunny. I was walking in front of a frat. when I heard Beach Boys á \Surfin'USA\". I had this overwhelming feeling that to be at CAL á
First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best á friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved á emotionally.

When I received the results from my final examination - Higher á School Certificate - and received a mark that was beyond my á wildest expectations.
Falling in love.
When I passed the university entrance exam.  I had thus finished á with a difficult period of my life and I was about to begin one á which I had desired a lot.
At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed á eachothers company, while slow dacing.

I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in á Madrid.
When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have á made a nice walk together.

Got through first semester University.

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her á and telling nice things to her.
Achieving my goal at a swim meet. I worked toward the goal for 9 á yrs. I was capable of achieving it, but I didn't know when.

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby á my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be á well catered for. This position fulfils a lot of my aims for the á last five years of my life.

I got an A in anatomy - the first one I have ever gotten in a á science class here.

I was talking to a friend and he said something which was very á funny.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from á airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in á contact again.

A few days ago, I hitch-hiked to Arnhems with a friend. á Everything went well: they picked us up very quickly, the sun was á shining, I was feeling free and, for the first time after long á time, happy. I really had the feeling that I was living at full á speed.
When my daughter gave her solo dance performance in Poona and á there was a big applause, I was overjoyed.
When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the á outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.
When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I á had waited a long time for this to occur.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last á 3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á Council.
Reading a letter from a close friend who said he missed me and á cared for me.
When I passed the university entrance exam.
The last time I had sex.
I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á time.

The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of á us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had á no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got á engaged.
Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

Article published.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time á and I had lost his address and telephone number.
When I was finally qualified for my profession.

Getting my accentance letter from CAL.

When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football á and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought á our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no á one expected we would win.

I was spending the week-end with some friends.  We were waiting á for another friend and we went to the meet him at the bus stop, a  á woman we met there told us that the coach had already left.  I á was afraid that I would not see my friend, but at last we found á him.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of á these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of á me having topped I could not believe it.
When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á marathon I wanted to see.
I feel unbelievably happy about the relationship between my á boyfriend and me, it is a reoccurring feeling.

When I fell crazily in love with a beautiful girl and she returned á my love.

Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his á studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he á was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also á because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the á test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we á found out that he succeded in entering at the University.
When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me á too.

One night, at a friend's place I realized that I had everything I á most wished, around me.

A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too á because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I á feel joy for her mainly.

This came in when at one time I met a girl who I didn't expect to á fall in love with me. Fortunately I tried my luck and she accepted á my proposal. At the same time she was giving me a lot of money á which was just like a miracle to me.
